newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico same-day peso recovers slightly at close.
newsitem.headline: Mexico same-day peso recovers slightly at close.

text.p: Mexico's same-day peso recouped some ground lost in early trade, but still closed 8.9 centavos weaker on Wednesday, at 7.83/7.84 per dollar in a session ridden by speculation and nerves, traders said.
"Its sheer speculation. There's no other way to explain the volatility," said a trader.
The same-day peso had opened over 11 centavos weaker.
The benchmark 48-hour peso and its 24-hour counterpart were meanwhile 6.25 and 6.2 centavos weaker, respectively, at 7.8450/7.8525 and 7.8350/7.8450 per dollar.
Traders noted that the peso had not reached support at 7.90 per dollar but did not rule out Central Bank intervention if the peso weakened to that level.
"I don't think they'll let it weaken that much so quickly, they'll probably drain liquidity from the secondary market, or maybe even intervene directly in the foreign exchange market," said a trader.
